message: In my room, I pull Ren out of my bag to wake him from sleep mode.
My head is killing me. Thinking fresh air might help, I go out onto the balcony.
The cool breeze feels nice.
Leaning on the handrail, I sigh and look up at the sky. The overlapping buildings obscure my view.
It hasn't always been like this. This island was once a beautiful place.
Midorijima is a remote island to the southwest of mainland Japan.

The island is known for its blue seas, white sands, and lush forests... or at least, it was.
That's ancient history now.
Now, Platinum Jail dominates the island, occupying nearly a full third of its landmass.
A huge wall separates Platinum Jail from the Old Residential District, so no one can even see what's inside.
You see bigshots from the Toue Corporation, the company that built Platinum Jail, on TV all the time.
Back when I was a kid, the Toue Corporation was trying to evict people from the island so they could start development.
They managed to convince most of the island's residents to leave with promises of luxurious homes and exorbitant sums of money.
But there were still some people who were too stubborn to go. Like us.
We weren't about to abandon our homes, no matter what juicy bait they dangled in front of us.
And for a while, Toue left us alone.
Toue's public stance on the issue was that they didn't want to force people out.
In reality, however, they were already plotting to show us the error of our ways.

It began with a reduction in basic utilities, explained as maintenance that never seemed to end.

The livable sphere slowly shrank, until the remaining residents were forced into what is now known as the Old Residential District.
This once beautiful island is in shambles... How could the government allow this?
Some of the islanders begged the government for help, but their petitions were all rejected.
Finally, three years ago, Toue started requiring residents of the Old Residential District to get permission before they could leave the island.
Permission they wouldn't grant. Ever.
I'm sure Toue's justification is that it's our fault for not leaving when we had the chance.
A noise at my feet snaps me out of my reverie.

name: 蓮
message: "Aoba, what do you want to do with the data from that email?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Email?"
Ren's question startles me off the handrail. I completely forgot.
Back at the store, while those kids were giving me trouble, my Coil downloaded some kind of file.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Was it a virus?"

name: 蓮
message: "I didn't detect anything."

name: 蒼葉
message: "So what is it?"

name: 蓮
message: "It's the type of game where the player character gains experience points and levels by doing battle with enemy characters."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Oh, an RPG? Does it cost anything?"

name: 蓮
message: "No, it's free."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Huh... At least those stupid brats didn't make me buy something by accident. Is it a trial version?"

name: 蓮
message: "That is unclear."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Well, if there's nothing fishy about it, I guess I could give it a try. Not like I have anything better to do."

name: 蓮
message: "Shall I start it?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Please."

name: 蓮
message: "Understood."
Cradling Ren in my arms, I go back inside and sit on the bed.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Talk about retro."
I bet those kids have never seen anything like this.
Even I've only seen games this old in videos.
The game's logo appears after the message from the princess.
Man, it's so old it almost feels new.
I press the START button.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Huh? To be continued? It's got episodes or something?"

name: 蓮
message: "Looks like it."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Oh. Well, I guess it was the perfect length to kill some time."
I don't really know if it was all that entertaining, but I might play more when the next installment comes out.
A yawn spills from my mouth as I close the game.
I was so focused on the game I didn't realize how tired I am.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Better get ready for bed."
I close the sliding glass door to the balcony and its curtain, then head to the bathroom.
